alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu; Cameron; Jefferson Davis (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 30 at 11:23PM CST until December 01 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CST FRIDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALCASIEU, NORTH CENTRAL CAMERON AND SOUTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON DAVIS PARISHES... At 1123 PM CST, Automated rain gauges indicated between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Doppler radar shows the heaviest rainfall has begun to shift east of the warned area, but light to moderate rain is still possible through the next hour or two. Flash flooding is still possible across the area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lake Charles, Iowa, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Grand Lake, Hayes, Holmwood, Hacketts Corner, Heberts Marina, Carlyss, Hackberry, Bell City and Lacassine. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
